Text.Value: I had nothing to do with it, I assure you.
I've no idea what you're talking about.
I played no part in this mischief. Now leave me be.
You'd be wise to mind your own business. Unless you want a taste of the same spell?
Mutter vile, hex-like syllables under your breath.
Go on, accuse me. I'll cast a spell to make you wish you'd never been born.
I confess, it was me.
*If you didn't seem guilty before, you certainly do now. Time to turn yourself in, or face the consequences.*
*Your attempted bribery has caused offence. It looks like you're destined for the cells.*
*Your gold buys contempt, but not freedom. You're about to be detained.*
I was merely demonstrating that spell. How else can one master the magical arts?
The victim is clearly delusional. I've been here the whole time and they've not changed one bit.
They're not the only one. Have you looked in the mirror recently?
*You could offer the lint in your purse, but you doubt that's valid currency.*
*Your humble purse won't cover this. Perhaps your golden tongue can help instead.*
*You don't have the gold to buy your way out of this situation.*
*You've been confronted by the victim of a rather aggressive spell. What do you have to say?*
*You recognise the after-effects of a spell. You also recognise that look of accusation. Were you responsible?*
*You see the tell-tale signs: this is a victim of a powerful spell. It seems you're being accused of casting it.*
*This is the victim of some potent magic. It seems the hunt is on for the one responsible - tread carefully.*
*Better gold in the palm than a sword in the throat.*
*Your little contribution soon clears things up. You're free to go.*
*A gift of gold, and just like that, your troubles are over.*
*The clink of gold leaving your purse - the sound of repercussions deftly avoided.*

EditorData.NodeContext: Don't allow infinite bribing for assault, not even for civilians

Text.Value: *Perhaps you're innocent after all. This won't go any further.*
*You're suitably convincing. Crisis averted.*
*Your words resolve the matter. You will not be disturbed further.*
*Your confession is unexpected, but changes nothing. You're about to be locked up.*
*Your honesty may be refreshing, but apparently it won't stop you being arrested.*
*Unfortunately, your admission doesn't absolve you of your crimes. Only time in the cells will do that.*
Try to talk your way out of it.
How about I transform you into an ant and squish you under my boot?
You've lived long enough to transform back. I'd quit while you're ahead.
Accuse me, and I'll transform you into a turkey, roast you, and eat you in your own gravy.
*That little confession appears to have sealed your fate.*
*Your confession is accepted. At least you'll die with your conscience clean.*
*You sense the pleasantries might be over. In fact, this could get very unpleasant indeed.*
All right, I confess. No need to stare at me like that.
Yes, it was me. What are you going to do about it?
You got me. It was a fun spell while it lasted.
*A case of mistaken identity - you obviously aren't the criminal in question.*
*You have a convincing air of innocence about you. That's enough for now.*
*The situation is quickly resolved. Clearly you're not the one responsible.*
*You're surprised to learn you can't pay your way out of this one. Violence it is.*
*Loosening your purse strings usually suffices, but not today. Your sins demand blood, not gold.*
*You're expected to pay with your life, not your gold.*
Attack.
How lucky, to experience the lived consciousness of another creature. That spell was a gift.
I've got better things to do with my time than such juvenile magic tricks.
What would I have to gain? Sure, it sounds hilarious, but I mean apart from that?
*You hoped you'd get away with that. Unfortunately, you haven't.*
*There's no doubt now: you're the evasive enchanter responsible, and you've been cornered...*
*You speak, but you are not listened to. This will only be decided one way: violently.*
*You've successfully persuaded the guard that you belong in a cell.*
*That might work on more gullible individuals, but this guard sees right through you. You're under arrest.*
*Your protestations have only confirmed your guilt. You're about to be arrested.*
*Someone's been casting some very unpleasant spells around here. It seems you appear just the type.*
*It seems trouble's brewing for whoever was casting spells nearby. Respond with care.*
*Some dangerous magic's been reported. You're accused of being the delinquent spellcaster.*
*Someone's been casting dangerous magic nearby. You're under suspicion - tread carefully.*
I don't think the spell's worn off yet. You might want to get that tail seen to...
I was attacked too! That knave turned me into a *squawk* chicken!
That was a spell of false accusation! See, would you be here accusing me otherwise?
Allow yourself to be arrested.
Perhaps some gold might settle this matter? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
*Gold may have made your problem go away this time, but next time you won't be so lucky.*
*The benefit of the doubt can only be bought so many times. This was the last of those times.*
*Improperly-acquired coin weighs heavy on the conscience. The bribe may have worked this time, but it won't work the next.*
*You've been given the benefit of the doubt this time, but something tells you next time you won't be so lucky.*
*You may have talked your way out of this one, but there will be no repeat performance.*
*You'll walk free, for now, but your stories won't land so well if you're caught again.*

Synopsis: An NPC was polymorphed/transmuted, then the polymorph wore off and they started looking for who did this to them, and is now interrogating a suspected player about this.
